definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: Or crazed with care, or cross'd in hopeless love.
sentences.chinese: 爲煩惱而瘋狂，爲無望的愛情悲喜。

sentences.english: Jia's Shaanxi Opera expresses a hopeless spiritual return to the hometown.
sentences.chinese: 賈平凹的《秦腔》正表達了這種無望的精神回鄉。

sentences.english: Li Zhe listens, he saw Yuexue Ji vainly asked, also lived in the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 李哲聽罷，又見約雪姬無望，於是要求也住在公寓裏。

sentences.english: Far away hopeless day of date of return.
However, a slower rate of increase led the government to suggest that the rise was tapering off.
sentences.chinese: 然而，儘管是緩慢速率的增加也使政府認爲復甦無望。

sentences.english: A man sing love songs, the white knuckles, declare we hopeless love .
sentences.chinese: 一個人唱情歌，泛白的指節，述說我們無望的愛情。

sentences.english: The koala evidently gave up all hope of escape and decided on the anti-dingo defense.
sentences.chinese: 那隻樹熊顯然覺得逃走無望，決定用對付野狗的招兒。

sentences.english: Gaowa is very good at English, but she is hopeless when it comes to sports.
sentences.chinese: 高娃很擅長英語，但是至於運動她就非常無望了。

sentences.english: You look in the mirror, berate yourself for gaining weight and then give in to feelings of depression and hopelessness.
sentences.chinese: 你照鏡子，責怪自己又胖了，然後只能沮喪和無望。

sentences.english: He conceded to newsmen that an immediate agreement was nowhere in sight.
sentences.chinese: 他向記者們承認近期內無望達成協議。

sentences.english: Lancer clutched desperately for what was no longer there.
sentences.chinese: 蘭瑟拼命而無望想去抓住消失的希拉。
男孩無望地聳了聳肩膀。

sentences.english: During the war, the soldiers despaired of ever coming home alive.
sentences.chinese: 醫生知道那傷兵的生命已經無望。

sentences.english: All this may sound hopelessly anti-American to some.
sentences.chinese: 對一些人來說，所有這些聽起來可能都是反美無望了。

sentences.english: We need to sift out the applications that have no chance of succeeding.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要剔出那些成功無望的申請。

definition: to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to degenerate/impoverished/to fall (into poverty)/to be reduced (to begging)
